intro: Centaurea charrelii, commonly known as the Alpina Centaury, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It is characterized by its bright blue to purple flowers and spiny, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Centaurea charrelii is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
